Dear Butler Public School Community,

Tomorrow, Thursday, May 30, 2019, The Butler Education Association and the Butler Municipal Alliance will be hosting former NBA player Chris Herren, who will speak to the community about the disease of substance abuse addiction.

Chris was a former college and NBA star who lost his career and almost his family to the disease of addiction.
Chris will be speaking about his real life struggles with addiction, advocate for effective treatment, and embrace the power of recovery.

This free program is sponsored by both the Butler Education Association and the Butler Municipal Alliance. Please see the attached document for more information.
The program will take place in the Butler High School Auditorium at 7pm.

Today at RBS...

Mrs. Tarr’s 8th grade students are connecting the puzzle pieces of Plate Tectonics... from changes in density to sea floor spreading, they are working to explain why the Earth’s crust is constantly moving!

Mrs. Tarr’s 6th grade classes are investigating how to measure speed by measuring the change in distance over time using our Car and Ramp Apparatus. They are also calculating how to not only calculate speed, but to predict changes in speed using formulas.

Students in Mrs. Koptyra’s classes created stories about water molecules traveling through the water cycle. Students chose digital storyboards or traditional comic strips to present their stories. Projects were peer evaluated during a gallery walk!

A big thank you to Butler NJ Pta for providing pizza parties for the 3 homerooms that won the membership drive! The students and teachers definitely enjoyed!

#greatthingsarehappeningatRBS #BDogPride
